tripreview.Title: "Nothing much.."
tripreview.sentence: Nothing much.
Seems like utter waste of time.
Don't expect to spot a Nilgiri tahr.
You have to be super fortunate for that.

tripreview.Title: "Pls don't go for this place"
tripreview.sentence: I request to don't spoil your time for this national park.
Firstly you will waste your 3-4 hours for the bus which will take you in this park.
In this so called national park you will found only 5-6 goats.
So pls don't go.
wastage of time and money.

tripreview.Title: "Saw the rare Nilgiri Tahr"
tripreview.sentence: We saw a small herd of about 4-6 of these.
They came down to the walking track making our climb up to the summit worthwhile.
Seeme tame but silly people try to feed them and touch them despite signs to the contrary.
The authorities take you up in a bus which does very well to navigate precipitous drops but great scenery on the way up and you can view this leisurely whr walking to see the animals.
There are huge queues and but for the fact our driver knew the ropes of prepaying in advance in town it still too about 30 mins to get through the priority queue.
I bought a great photo calendar published by the parks which some locals poo poohed.
Queue jumping on the return journey seemed to be common !

tripreview.Title: "A good climb!"
tripreview.sentence: Its a national park on the hills.
So firstly there is a rickety bus drive till there .
which is quite an experience in itself!
We got a weird driver so the ride was very exciting for us.
Once you reach the entry point you are dropped off and then on its a climb.
Well paved roads take you up so the walk is good.
There are resting points at the hairpin bends for ones who arent too excited about getting to the top.
Once closer to the top is where you spot the Mountain goats :) Its a well organised climb with resting and drinking water facilities at convenient points.
Overall a good experience.

tripreview.Title: "Heaven On Earth"
tripreview.sentence: The Best place I have visited in Munnar.
It is situated on the top of the mountain.
You Might not get to see Nilgiri Thar but you will surely get to see beautiful locations from the top of the mountain.
The small and the Big waterfalls are like the cherry on the cakes they r amazing.
Awesome climate and worth seeing this place.

tripreview.Title: "A tryst with the Tahr: Wilderness escapes"
tripreview.sentence: Me and my husband, being wildlife enthusiasts, could not help but decide upon the famous residence of the Nilgiri Tahr as our first goto point during our stay at Munnar.
So we set off on the next day of our arrival, standing in the ticket line for a good 20 minutes to catch a glimpse of what this animal was all about !
A mini bus takes all the tourists up to the point from where the 2-3 km long winding trek starts.
We help onto our seats with each winding turn.
With each ascent , the tea valleys below mesmerized us and pleased our souls no end !
White mists and green patches of happiness seemed to greet our eyes everywhere.
Finally we arrived at the trekking point.
The park has been maintained as a haven where the once endangererd Nilgiri Tahr is now protected and roams freely.
We were amazed by the well set-up museum that housed realms of information - for a person truly interested in understanding this species, plan to dedicate a good 45 minute to the museum itself.
We then started the trail and to our joy saw our first Tahr right ahead, 10feet away !
Oblivious to the human beings, the cute animal continued grazing.
A couple of others too were spotted walking alongside the human beings, as if they were totally accustomed to tourists !
It was a great moment as we clicked photos with few of them and they seemed to pose for the cam !
Further ahead, towards the top, we came across water rapids where few Tahrs were enjoying a leisurely drink.
It was an amazing wildlife moment as I got to capture loads of poses , from the typical "Tahr jutting out from the hillside" to the portrait with their curved horns !
And also a selfie with this cute goat-antelope !
Rajamalai is a must visit for all those who with to know about nature.
A great way to introduce kids to wildlife by getting up, close and personal a day visit it this National Park is worth !

tripreview.Title: "Tour requires quite some time"
tripreview.sentence: The queue to get on the bus to the park was long on the way up and then down.
We gave up the first day and went back the second day.
Buy tickets at the park office in Munnar, it is much faster (although you still have to queue to get on the bus).
Once you get to the top, you need to keep walking at least another 25min to get to a first scenic area.
We stopped walking before because we were limited by time, it seems like you need at least a few hours to enjoy anything.
We just saw a few mountain goats at the entrance, not sure if you much more wildlife.
A bit disappointing overall.
Less exciting than a walk through the tea plantation for us.
About 5km further up from the park entrance, there are beautiful tea plantation areas where you can walk freely from the road down to a little valley with river.

tripreview.Title: "nice climb"
tripreview.sentence: this is good climb.
almost 2 miles up the hills.

tripreview.Title: "Superb location and nice drive"
tripreview.sentence: It was a good place to visit in munnar nice location and very good ambience.

tripreview.Title: "Superb Location"
tripreview.sentence: Are you planning to go for any tour or have an idea of going.
Then do not worry Rajamal Travels is there for you to make your trip easy.
They provide cars, vans which ever is comfortable we can afford.
Thus they make our journey happy.

tripreview.Title: "Great place for nature lovers"
tripreview.sentence: Must go place for nature lovers, we can see thar goat so close and a great view of tea plantation.
Best time to visit is in the morning when we can see wildlife and also avoid the long wait for taking ticket and huge crowd.

tripreview.Title: "Rajamalai - The abode of The Nilgiri Tahr"
tripreview.sentence: Situated at the mountain top, a beautiful national park of its kind.
Your tour bus /car will leave you at the entrance of the park.
From there, you go up the hill in the park's own buses.
There is an entry fee and a separate camera fee.
Cell phone cameras won't be charged.
There is a huge line at the entrance to take the tickets.
The park has a number of buses to take you up.
The road is very narrow.
One gets to see beautiful views of sprawling tea plantations and of course the Anamudi Peak.
After around 10-15 minutes of climb in the bus, you get down at the entrance of the main abode of the Nilgiri Tahr.
From here you climb up the hill (there is a proper road) on your foot.
If you are lucky, you may see the Nilgiri Tahr.
We saw 2 of them.
It is not routine to see the Nilgiri Tahr.
There are ample of locations to take snaps.
Make sure to spend at least 2-3 hours or more.
Once you tour the top on your foot, again climb down, and stand in a long queue for the return bus till the entrance.
A must visit place if you visit Munnar.

tripreview.Title: "Good travelling experience"
tripreview.sentence: Visitting to Rajmalai National Park is good travelling experience
but not much to see
Jungle bakree is the animal of attraction but not guaranteed that it can also be seen

tripreview.Title: "Good location"
tripreview.sentence: The place is a good location in kerala.
Beautiful place.
We are in love with munnar.
It is such a awsome place.

tripreview.Title: "Great place"
tripreview.sentence: This is a great place to visit.
Such and beautiful place in earth.
One of the highest peak in Kerala.

tripreview.Title: "Visit for the views only"
tripreview.sentence: It's located on the highest peak on southern part of western ghats.
You can reach midway to this hill through the bus provided by national park for which you have to buy tickets.
We were told that there will be long ques for the ticket but we didn't find so.
After the bus ride you need to walk to the top of the hill, which is somewhat 2-3 kms far.
A small fall is on the way.
As for the wild animals, you won't see anything except mountain goats.

tripreview.Title: "Waste of Time!!!!"
tripreview.sentence: Its a waste of time to wait in the que to enter the park.
It took almost 3 hours in just waiting.
But after entering the park, the view was too good.
If there is time, its a must watch place.
It is the south india's highest peak.

tripreview.Title: "Favorite nature experience in Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: Loved the national park.
We thought it was great.
The "hiking" is more like walking along a paved road with nature on both sides, but the views were great.
And after a few days driving from place to place and just having short "photo snaps", it was nice to spend a little while walking around.
We were also lucky enough to see multiple Nilgiri Tahr, which was a special treat.
ADVICE: PURCHASE YOUR ENTRANCE TICKETS IN ADVANCE.
OTHERWISE YOU WILL BE WAITING IN A VERY LONG LINE.

tripreview.Title: "Good views, nice sightings of Thar. Pleasant experience. "
tripreview.sentence: Nice trip.
Recommended buying reservation in nearby town centre to skip into shorter ticket queue.
Pleasant walk.
Fabulous views.
Saw the Thar after short ride on park bus.
Lots of Indian families visiting.
Only a fairly short walk round, uphill.
We enjoyed it.

tripreview.Title: "Amazing place to go, BUT - please avoid peak season and holidays"
tripreview.sentence: This either can be a once in a life time experience or a run of the mill tourist stop, it all depends on how crowded the place is.
If you want to enjoy the place the way it should be - pls plan ahead and ONLY go there during off season or on days when you are sure it is not crowded.

tripreview.Title: "Stunning views and we saw the illusive goats!"
tripreview.sentence: We started early in the morning to avoid the queues - worth it as they were very long when we got back
the bus ride was an adventure in itself - all along the hair-pin bends as we climbed higher and higher.
the the trek higher still was worth it as the views were stunning all around
made memorable by all the young Indian girls wanting selfies with us
everyone so friendly and excitable.
The scenery was breathtaking!

tripreview.Title: "Great Trek, Eye catching view and mountain goats"
tripreview.sentence: First thing you notice about the park is that it has a great view of the Tea garden whens entering the park.
For families and travelers be sure to book the entry passes online since there is a huge line at the entrance for tickets which might use up at least 2 hours of your time!
The bus ride till the park entrance shows the best of tea gardens and as it slowly goes up the hill the view becomes more and more beautiful!
You will find tons of mountain goats chilling and jumping around with some great flora on the mountain faces and the trek route.
Be sure to carry a good camera and a couple of water bottles since the trek is bit long.
Also go till the very end of the trek trail since the best view comes at the top and you can even view it from binoculars if the climate is clear.
Best time to visit is during early morning or late evening since at that time the fog is clear and you can see the whole mountain range in front of the park.

tripreview.Title: "you need to eat more food before to visit this place"
tripreview.sentence: i have Worst experience with this place.
there is long 'Q' like tirumala to take tickets for this place.
after lot of struggle i got tickets.
when i reached the final point i walked almost 4 to 5 km to watch mountain goats that to only 3.
almost i wasted half day in my trip due to this.
better you skip this place if u r trip is short.

tripreview.Title: "Worst going"
tripreview.sentence: I walked for miles just to see only one goat.
But you can walk a lot and have a good view from the mountain.

tripreview.Title: "One can visit this in case of having sufficient time"
tripreview.sentence: One can visit this place, if someone is having enough time to stay in Munnar.
In case of short trip of Kerala, this point can be skipped.

tripreview.Title: "Nilgiri Tahrs and Splendid location"
tripreview.sentence: Nilgiri Tahrs is generally known for their shy nature and hence it is not easy to spot them in wild.
But Tahr here are used of human beings that, they are no more shy, and are not afraid of human.
They will come close to us and some even pose for photos.
They are not bothered about human presence and is busy in their routine lifeline.
Hence, if you want to spot this animal in wild, this is the place.
National Park Van, will take you till 3/4th of the total distance and the rest 1/4th you have to walk.
It is in the last 1/4th, where you will find Tahrs.
Initial 3/4 is full of tea estates, but give awesome view of Rajamalai and Anamudi hills.
Another place in Munnar for photographers and nature enthusiast.
During weekends, getting a ticket will be tough, as queue length will be very long.
If you are ready to spend extra Rs50.
Book ticket online.
If you book online, you can reduce the waiting time that one has to spend by standing in queue for ticket.

tripreview.Title: "Total waste of time."
tripreview.sentence: Its good you can skip it if you are coming munnar for 1 day.
If people intrested in trekking then yes this is must go place but not for visiting.
We hardly spent their 1 hr and got a chance to see only 1 Nilgiri tahir which is a jungle goat.
So,its better you skip it.

tripreview.Title: "Place with great view of munnar"
tripreview.sentence: If you are a nature lover you should definitely visit this place.
Make sure you reach the park early morning else you will not get tickets for entering the park.
We had to wait for 2.5hours in the queue to get tickets.
Also there are no other animals apart from nilgiri tahr, but they are abundant.

tripreview.Title: "Skip this place as nothing was there to see"
tripreview.sentence: We went in Jan 24th and there was nothing to see after almost 1hr waiting to get ticket in queue and 5kms trek you wont found anything not even a single animal(we wait there for 2hrs from 4pm to 6pm so the we can see something but could not ) and it was so hot in Jan then you can assume how it would be in summer.
only postive thing is you will have a great view of tea gardens in the journey.

tripreview.Title: "You can skip it"
tripreview.sentence: You can skip it nothing worth or may be don't spend more than half an hour.

tripreview.Title: "Nilgiri Tahr.. Awesome Mausam.. 4 km Trek"
tripreview.sentence: In few words :Nilgiri Tahr.
Awesome Mausam.
4 km Trek Yes
When we reached the park, weather suddenly changed from Sunlight to clouds to mist pouring to again sunlight n then mist.
as if heaven also wanted to enjoy with us.
Niligiri Tahr and many birds welcomed us.
Though tourists were allowed only till a certain distance but the sight of having Niligiri Tahr near us and beautiful water bodies captivated our thoughts for the time we were there.

tripreview.Title: "The greens!!"
tripreview.sentence: After the parking, the journey between the tea gardens were amazing.
Not much animals but scenic beauty is wonderful.

tripreview.Title: "Breath taking"
tripreview.sentence: You better be prepared to walk 4 kms trek.
But when you reach well you would feel a sense of peace and achievement.
The place is BEAUTIFUL.
If you are lucky you get to see Kurinji.
The rare species of goats are must watch.
Try not to go near them but do take some close shots

tripreview.Title: "Waste of time"
tripreview.sentence: No wildlife in the park.
Waste of time and money.

tripreview.Title: "National park"
tripreview.sentence: This is the quite nice national park in Munnar.
It is having good facility to roam around and beautiful atmosphere.

tripreview.Title: "Amazing view"
tripreview.sentence: Journey to national park was amazing specially after noon time as we enjoyed the beauty of mist and mountain during the journey .
Once reach the park will feel top of the mountain andit was very pleasant weather during time .

tripreview.Title: "good trip for a couple of hours"
tripreview.sentence: If you are expecting a park kind of trip, you will be in for disappointment.
You get to see lots of these amazing Nilgiri tahr though.

tripreview.Title: "Magnificient view, Good for site seeing but not for wildlife"
tripreview.sentence: Very good place for admirers of natural beauty.
Nice view from the top point.
Its a photogenic place.
Bus will take you to the starting point, it will take about 15-20 mins in bus.
Then there is around 1.5-2 km of walking where you will enjoy the siteseeing.
you may encounter several wild goats on the way.

tripreview.Title: "Nothing much to expect "
tripreview.sentence: While in Munnar, everybody goes for Eravikulam National Park.
You need to buy tickets for entry and the bus takes you through the tea estates to the entry point.
From this place you may walk and go to the last point.
You may find many fellow travellers walking along and the place becomes too crowed at times.
The park opens from 7 30 AM and if you can manage, better go in the morning.
The tickets are also sold online and it is perhaps better to prebook your tickets as huge crowd is witnessed for buying tickets and it may take around 1 hour or more to get tickets in rush hour.
It will result in less time left for you to explore Munnar.
As far as spotting Nilgiri Thar is concerned, that is a matter of luck and such crowd will definitely scare away animals.
I got a chance to spot wild elephants in tea estate sorrounding the Park.

tripreview.Title: "Its a park not a place to see wildlife"
tripreview.sentence: The park closes by 4:30 .
You get to see only goats .
It has a lot of natural scenery .
A haven for selfie lovers and photographers However that doesnt make up for the time needed to travel to the destination .

tripreview.Title: "Lots of Nihil Tahrs to see, but attraction is slightly overrated"
tripreview.sentence: Very nice to see this endangered species (and there were many animals, including babies), but there can be a long line up to get on the buses, so go early in the day.
You take a walk up a winding paved road, and there is a waterfall which would be more impressive just after the rainy season.
Also, in December there were not many flowers to see in the park.
The road dead-ends after about 20 minutes, and there is no shade, but some nice views of the mountains.
I applaud the Keralan government for taking the initiative to set this up, but it is a bit regimented, and not the equivalent of taking a leisurely hike up a forest trail.

tripreview.Title: "Good place to visit but huge rush"
tripreview.sentence: Need to book in advance, booking starts 48 hours before and I think there is an online option as well.

tripreview.Title: "Please avoid"
tripreview.sentence: The only thing to look is the wild Thar that are protected by the park if you are looking for wild animals.
There are many species of plants that you can see particularly a plant which the flower blossoms once in a twelve year period.
There is also a small waterfall, almost dry in winter and summers.
The bus will take you to the top and will have to walk for around 1.5 kms.
After a certain point entry is restricted but the view is better from the top.

tripreview.Title: "Spectacular View from the top"
tripreview.sentence: This place is at very high altitude and there are buses which take you to the top.
There is a small walk/trek of about 1km after the bus ride.
There is a great view of the peak and also the valley from the top.
The waterfalls have very less water in the month of December.
Not many animals to see though over here.

tripreview.Title: "Book in advance and go early."
tripreview.sentence: Booked a day in advance at the Forest Warden's office in Munnar(Rs 50).
By 9:30am the next day it was already crowded.
But the advance booking line was empty.
Bought a ticket for Rs 90 and was ushered into the bus ahead of the other queue.
The bus takes you through the visitor zone, very picturesque, up the high rolling plateau.
The panoramic views of the tea gardens, the valley, the hills including Anamudi, the highest peak of the Western Ghats, are mesmerizing.
After being dropped at the visitors center, you can enter the park, after a security check,you can walk up the winding road following the plateau for about 1.5kms.
The walk is not difficult and can be done leisurely enjoying the views.
Halfway through you can spot the nilgiri tahrs and by the time you reach the end point there are plenty of them.
The views of the shola grasslands and the clouds over the mountains are absolutely stunning!
By 11:30am the tourists were swarming in and the queue a mile long.
The sun is sharp, use sunblock, carry sunglasses, cap and water.
The tourist center has decent toilets.

tripreview.Title: "Mountains and Nilgiri Tahr"
tripreview.sentence: The Park is situated on the crest of the Western Ghats and is mountainous.
Admission is by bus only and costs 3 dollars for non Indians .
This takes you half way up the mountain then it is by foot to various viewing points.
Generally excellent but you are exposed to the weather.
On the way back down I spotted a wild elephant; that was enough for the driver to stop the bus so everyone got to see one of Kerala's favourite animals.

tripreview.Title: "Good view and lot of Nilgiri thar"
tripreview.sentence: We saw loads and loads of Nilgiri thar's.
The view is good also at the top.
The entrance fee is decent.
you have to wait in queue for an hour or so to get a ticket.
After that a bus would pick you up and drop you at the entrance of the national park.
You are actually walking in between the goats.
You are not allowed to touch them.
super cute creatures.
The only drawback probably is the wait time.

tripreview.Title: "Very nice of the peak and a nice walk"
tripreview.sentence: The national park is located 20 mins away from the city and offers a panaromic view of the mountains and the tea gardens.
Unlike the top station where the person has to walk a lot, here the bus takes you to the top and then you can go for a short walk if you desire.

tripreview.Title: "The view is beautiful."
tripreview.sentence: I visited there in December and there were holidays across kerala so the ticket line was so long that I have wait for 2 hrs just to get the tickets.
However the park was very beautiful
and u will get to see only nilgiri tahr there.

tripreview.Title: "Not a single animal seen"
tripreview.sentence: I was very disappointed with the visit as firstly had to wait for 2 hrs in queue to get the ticket and then not even a single animal was spotted.

tripreview.Title: "Nothing exciting"
tripreview.sentence: It's a natural sanctuary.
The vehicle goes only till a specific point.
There's a 2km walk then to see just a goat.
So overall you can enjoy the scenic beauty.
Visit to enjoy the view.

tripreview.Title: ""Every one who goes to Munnar should visit this place""
tripreview.sentence: Its very difficult to take ticket from there because of the very big queue.
There is some reservation tickets facility from Munnar town also so better reserve tickets before going here.

tripreview.Title: "We felt waste of time"
tripreview.sentence: Our driver told alot about this park .
We stood an hour in queue to get a ticket .
But finally after reaching there , it went in vain .
The only good thing excellent view , except that you cant even find a single animal around .
Long unnecessary walk .

tripreview.Title: "Most Sought after destination in Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: The park offers a magnificent view of the tea plantations and also of the rolling hills caressed by blankets of mist.
Spread over a very wide area, the park offers the best place to retreat far off from the maddening chaos in the urban areas.

tripreview.Title: "good place"
tripreview.sentence: Need to go early morning to avoid long queue and travel 20 minutes by their vehicle and then walk 3 kms to see the endangered animal.

tripreview.Title: "Rajamala Wildlife Sanctuary - the home for the endangered Nilgiri Tahr"
tripreview.sentence: Rajamala Wildlife Sanctuary is part of the Eravikulam Wildlife Sanctuary.
It is the home to over half of the population of the endangered Nilgiri Tahr.
The sanctuary is located in Idukki district of Kerala about 15 km away from the popular hill station, Munnar.

tripreview.Title: "Great view, avarage park"
tripreview.sentence: To reach the park up in the mountains, you must buy a ticket in a huge line.
Park buses will take you up to the park, with under way some very nice views of the tea gardens and surrounding mountains.
The view is amazing, but that's really all you get.
We saw the sheep really close, but to me these aren't wild, as large groups of people took selfies with them.
To go down we had to wait for about an hour to get a bus.
So for view go up there, for wildlife there are probably better places.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful place"
tripreview.sentence: The national park is situated on a hill and there are other hills surrounding the place making it a treat for photographers.
Do not expect many animals to be seen in the place, but there are many places sight seeing.
The place is well managed with strict rules against littering.
Very serene and picturesque and a must visit for people who seek tranquality.

tripreview.Title: "Must go to see carnivorous plants "
tripreview.sentence: The only attractions we had to locate insect eating plants.
We could locate them as well.
